item.title: 米内務省報告：2020年、ジョージ・フロイドの抗議活動を取材するオーストラリア人ジャーナリスト2名に対し、公園警察官2名が過剰な力を行使（Emily Steel/New York Times）
item.description:
Emily Steel / New York Times:
US Interior Department report: two Park Police officers used excessive force against two Australian journalists covering a George Floyd protest in 2020  —  The Interior Department concluded that U.S. Park Police officers exceeded the “minimum level of reasonable force” during a George Floyd protest in 2020.

item.title: メディアの未来に賭けたプライベート・エクイティの不運な賭けが崩れ去ったViceの没落を詳細に分析、4億5000万ドルを投資したTPGを非難する株主も (Financial Times)
item.description:
Financial Times:
An in-depth look at Vice's downfall, as private equity's ill-fated bet on the future of media fell apart; some shareholders blame TPG, which invested $450M  —  The evaporation of TPG's $450mn investment shows what can happen when Wall Street collides with an uncontrollable creative industry

item.title: ElevenLabs などのスタートアップのAI音声ツールを使って作られた「The Joe Rogan AI Experience」や「Myself, I Am and That」など、AIが生成したポッドキャストを見てみよう（Kate Knibbs/Wired)
item.description:
Kate Knibbs / Wired:
A look at AI-generated podcasts, like “The Joe Rogan AI Experience” and “Myself, I Am and That”, created using AI voice tools from ElevenLabs and other startups  —  Inside the strange world of podcasts made by artificial intelligence, where even creators aren't sure who wants to hear robot chit-chat.

item.title: AIツールを使って誰でもGrimesの曲を作れるように招待したGrimesに、自分の声のオープンソース化、AIへのこだわり、GrimesAIで作られた5曲についてQ&A（Joe Coscarelli/New York Times）
item.description:
Joe Coscarelli / New York Times:
Q&A with Grimes, who invited anyone to make Grimes songs using AI tools, on open-sourcing her voice, her obsession with AI, and five GrimesAI-created tracks  —  The producer and pop singer, long a proponent of technological experimentation, has “open-sourced” her voice using new A.I. tools.

item.title: Gray Televisionが、1つの市場で上位4つのテレビ局のうち2つを所有することを禁止するGrayの違反の疑いに対して昨年課された50万ドル以上の罰金について、FCCを提訴（Matthew Keys/The Desk）。
item.description:
Matthew Keys / The Desk:
Gray Television sues the FCC over a $500K+ fine imposed last year for Gray's alleged violation of a ban on owning two of the top four TV stations in a market  —  The agency fined Gray more than a half-million dollars for operating a CBS and NBC affiliate in Anchorage.

item.title: YouTube、Peacock、Amazonを含むNFLのストリーミングポートフォリオの拡大を見て、ライブスポーツの未来がケーブルバンドルの外にあることを示す（Tom Kludt/Vanity Fair）。
item.description:
Tom Kludt / Vanity Fair:
A look at the NFL's widening streaming portfolio, including YouTube, Peacock, and Amazon, signaling that the future of live sports is outside the cable bundle  —  Football still dominates traditional TV ratings, but the league's deals with YouTube, Peacock, and Amazon—all while ESPN considers …

item.title: ワシントン・ポスト発行人兼CEOのフレッド・ライアンが、戦略と優先順位に取り組む「AIタスクフォース」と、運用チーム「AIハブ」の2つのAIチームを発表（ワシントン・ポスト）。
item.description:
Washington Post:
Washington Post Publisher and CEO Fred Ryan announces two AI teams: the AI Taskforce, working on strategy and priorities, and the AI Hub, an operational team  —  Announcement from Publisher and CEO Fred Ryan on The Post's next steps in AI innovation:  —  Dear Washington Post colleagues,

item.title: 出願：バイデン政権は、ジーニアスの歌詞書き起こしの盗用疑惑をめぐるグーグルに有利な2022年の控訴審判決をSCOTUSは放置すべきとする（Blake Brittain/Reuters)
item.description:
Blake Brittain / Reuters:
Filing: the Biden administration says SCOTUS should let stand a 2022 appeals court ruling favoring Google over its alleged theft of Genius' lyric transcriptions  —  The Biden administration's U.S. solicitor general said Tuesday that the U.S. Supreme Court should not review a ruling won …

item.title: フロリダ州知事ロン・デサンティスのTwitter Spacesでの大統領選発表では、クラッシュ、フィードバックの不具合、音声の失敗が発生（Kevin Breuninger/CNBC)
item.description:
Kevin Breuninger / CNBC:
Florida Governor Ron DeSantis' presidential campaign announcement on Twitter Spaces suffers crashes, feedback glitches, and audio failures  —  - Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis' presidential campaign announcement plans evening were derailed by massive technical glitches on Twitter that prevented him from declaring his candidacy.

item.title: The MessengerとCNNはどちらもダウン・ザ・ミドルなニュースを約束し、「偏ったメディア」への解毒剤として売り込もうとしているが、人々がそれを望んでいる証拠はほとんどない（Peter Kafka/Vox）。
item.description:
Peter Kafka / Vox:
Both The Messenger and CNN promise down-the-middle news and try to sell themselves as antidotes to “biased media”, but there's little evidence people want that  —  CNN and the Messenger both say they're chasing the middle.  Uh-oh.  —  Item 1: Last week, the Messenger …

item.title: インサイダー・ユニオンによると、組合員の94％が、賃金、レイオフ、ヘルスケアなどをめぐる最初の契約を交渉する間、ストライキを承認する投票をしたという。（The NewsGuild of New York）
item.description:
The NewsGuild of New York:
The Insider Union says 94% of its members voted to authorize a strike while the union negotiates its first contract over wages, layoffs, health care, and more  —  Vote follows management illegally changing workers' health care and a proposal in April to lay off 20% of bargaining unit

item.title: フォーブスのある寄稿者は、2つの記事原稿を「承認と変更のために最初に」情報源に送った。他の作家は、ジャーナリズムに損害を与える行為として批判している（Andrew Fedorov/The Fine Print）。
item.description:
Andrew Fedorov / The Fine Print:
A Forbes contributor sent two story drafts to his source “first for approval and changes”; other writers are criticizing the practice as damaging to journalism  —  A publicist's email snafu reveals the lax editorial standards — allowing sources to review copy before publication …

item.title: 長編小説を書くための生成AIツール、SudowriteのStory Engineをハンズオン！予想以上によく動くが、まだ大きな限界がある（Adi Robertson/The Verge）
item.description:
Adi Robertson / The Verge:
Hands-on with Sudowrite's Story Engine, a generative AI tool for writing long-form fiction novels that works better than expected but still has big limitations  —  Thoughts are swarming my mind like a nest of cyber-rats.  —  Last week, generative fiction tool Sudowrite launched a system for writing whole novels.

item.title: 反発を受けたMaxは、監督と脚本家を「クリエイター」にまとめていた技術的な「見落とし」を理由に、映画のクレジット表記を分割して変更する予定です（Todd Spangler/Variety）。
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
After backlash, Max will change back film credit listings to break out directors and writers, blaming a technical “oversight” for grouping them under “creators”  —  Now the company says it is changing the listings back to how they were presented on HBO Max, blaming the issue on a technical “oversight.”

item.title: リンダ・ヤッカリーノの主な課題は、イーロン・マスクを満足させながらTwitterの広告主との関係を改善することで、情報筋によると、彼女は自分の知名度を上げたいと考えているようだ（Sarah Frier/Bloomberg)
item.description:
Sarah Frier / Bloomberg:
Linda Yaccarino's main challenge will be improving Twitter's advertiser relationships while keeping Elon Musk happy; sources say she wants to raise her profile  —  Elon Musk joked in December that he'd step down as Twitter's chief executive officer once he found someone “foolish enough” to take his place.
